content.full_text: Check of Levi Davis to Abraham Lincoln, 17 December 18401 Cashier of theState Bank of Illinois, Pay toAbraham Lincolnor order, the sum ofFiftydollars andcents, it being inpartfor his services as a Member of theGeneral Assembly, Session 1840 & ‘412 (The holder of this warrant will be entitled to six per cent interest from date, until redeemed by theState.) (Countersigned and Registered.)
paragraphs: Check of Levi Davis to Abraham Lincoln, 17 December 18401 Cashier of theState Bank of Illinois, Pay toAbraham Lincolnor order, the sum ofFiftydollars andcents, it being inpartfor his services as a Member of theGeneral Assembly, Session 1840 & ‘412 (The holder of this warrant will be entitled to six per cent interest from date, until redeemed by theState.) (Countersigned and Registered.)
citations: An Act Making Appropriations for the Years 1841 and 1842.

footnotes.text:
1This partially printed check was filled in by Levi Davis and signed by Davis and John
                  D. Whiteside. Abraham Lincoln endorsed it on the back side.

2Members of the General Assembly earned $4 for each day’s attendance at the session,
                  plus an additional $4 for every twenty miles of necessary travel in coming to and
                  returning from the statehouse.An Act Making Appropriations for the Years 1841 and 1842.
